alert.note: Alert for Adair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 12:13PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Missouri and northeast Missouri, including the following counties, in north central Missouri, Linn MO, Macon, Putnam and Sullivan. In northeast Missouri, Adair and Schuyler. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1210 PM CDT, Rainfall from Friday Night into early Saturday Morning resulted in flooding across the area. As of late Saturday morning, several roads were still closed across the area, and a few roads were reported as washed away. While flooding conditions have not become worse, there are still areas of high standing water. Therefore, the Flood Warning has been extended. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kirksville, Milan, La Plata, Green City, Queen City, Novinger, Greentop, Greencastle, Brashear, Browning, Purdin, Humphreys, Gibbs, Millard, Worthington, Elmer, South Gifford, Green Castle, Winigan and New Boston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
